bug.author: jihunchoi
bug.summary: The updated documentation site does not contain "Setting up TensorFlow for Development"
bug.description: Recently the TensorFlow web site is updated, and some contents are re-organized. Since I always forget how to install TF from sources, such as "bazel build ..." then "bazel-bin/...", I frequently refer the official web site. However, after the update, "Setting up TensorFlow for Development" section has gone away (which were originally located at <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.12/get_started/os_setup>https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.12/get_started/os_setup</denchmark-link> ). I think the contents should be included in "Installing TensorFlow from sources" section, if there was no change in the way for setting for development.

comments.comment: Good catch and sorry for the omission. I will get it added back in a couple of days.

It looks like that this has been fixed in the latest release. See: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/install/>https://www.tensorflow.org/install/</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_sources>https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_sources</denchmark-link>
